Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two different habitats, one on land (like a garden or forest) and one in water (like a pond or stream).
The student can include different types of plants and animals in each habitat (such as trees, grasses, fish, and squirrels).
The student can show how these plants and animals live in each habitat.
The student can label or describe the differences in living things between the two habitats.
The student can illustrate patterns in the types of living things found in each habitat (like why certain animals live in certain places).
